Reviews.Title: Great Camera...Poor Battery Life
Reviews.Author: D. Fieselman
Reviews.Content: I have had the Olympus FE-310 camera for about one month.  The camera takes great pictures and is easy to operate.  This camera seems pretty good overall.  There are a few things that I wish I had known before I made this purchase however.1.  The 2 AA batteries do not last very long.  The digital screen is easy to see, but drains the batteries far too quickly.  You cannot turn off the digital screen without turning the camera off.  Be aware that you may need one or more battery changes per day if you are shooting a moderate amount of pictures.  This camera has frozen up twice because it needed a battery change immediately following my attempt to take a picture. When I started the shot the battery indicator showed full and then it failed to record the photo because the battery was dead.  There is no midpoint on the battery indicator.  I don't know if I got a bad camera or if everyone has the same problem.2.  This has been mentioned by another user but it is worth noting, this camera reverts to default settings each time it is turned on.  There is no way to save your personal preferences.  This is a big deal!  Imagine being at an event where you need to shoot a picture once every minute or so with an adjusted setting.  As I have said, leaving the camera on would nearly guarantee a battery change within an hour.  Now each time you turn the camera back on you find yourself adjusting for flash off or whatever special setting you need while your photo opportunity escapes!  Had I known about this weakness I would have purchased another camera.3.  The shutter button and zoom control are located in the same spot.  It is a bit tricky to operate effectively but it can be done with some practice.All things considered this would be a great camera if I didn't use it so often.  I like it enough to keep it, but use caution if this camera is for work or regular moderate use.

Reviews.Title: This is a no-brainer to operate!
Reviews.Author: Patricia L. Hinaman "photophreak"
Reviews.Content: Olympus FE-310 8MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black)This camera is one of the best digital cameras I have ever used. It takes easy perfect Photos, and what you see is what you get. It has a menu that even a novice could use. It is really that easy. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who,in the past was afraid. A great product!

Reviews.Title: Great bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Paul Dockter "Doc"
Reviews.Content: Well I did a lot of homework before I bought this camera.  I wanted AA batteries (I travel a lot with no outlets), at least a 5X zoom and some sort of image stabilization.  The 2 gig card gives over 400 pics on the highest resolution so no worrys about downloading often on the go.  The image stabilization is not active, what it does is ups your shutter speed so it's not really image stabilized.  Battery life is good not great probably because of the large LCD on the back of the camera.  A viewfinder would have been nice.  All and all I doubt you could find a better camera for the amount of money.  Pictures are great, 5X zoom is nice, optical zoom is great, digital zoom has only limited use because it sacrifices quality, but it does zoom way in.  A nice feature is that if you wonder about how to set the camera there is a guide mode and a scene mode that will make it very easy for you.

Reviews.Title: Great features - extremely poor battery usage
Reviews.Author: Gamul "Gamul1"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and has excellent features.  Others have talked about the features so I will not expand on those, but I do want to add my voice to the growing chorus of people who have been suckered by Olympus to by this battery sucker.The only batter you may have luck with is the Panasonic Industrial battery that it comes with, and can be purchased for a pretty penny online.Every ready batterys? Camera won't work at all.  Duracell? I get around 10 pictures on each set. Only the panasonic industrials work "ok".I complained to Olympus and they denied any issue, only saying I needed to use a good enough AA.  Buzz off to them!  It should work with any AA, not special AA's!I am now waiting for the class action lawsuit so I can get my money back as the store I bought this at won't take it back anymore. - its older than 1 month.

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE-310
Reviews.Author: Juanita Williams
Reviews.Content: I had read that the Olympus 2 Master disc was difficult to install, but, that is not true. It went in like a champ, and gives you everything you'd want to create your photos with.  The Macro and Super Macro work excellent!  The sntishake mechanism keep down alot of otherwise blurry shots.  I haven't yet tried the panorama feature, but everything is explained clearly in the book, and just taking your camera and going thru step-by-step, you will see how easy it is to use!!  It gives you all the info on the screen that you need, to take beautiful pictures.  You can almost count individual hair strands on close-ups, and scenery pictures are gorgeous.  You can't go wrong with this camera.  I'm really glad I got it!!

Reviews.Title: Batteries are everything
Reviews.Author: R. MacDonald
Reviews.Content: I also bought this camera and  experienced poor battery life. After reading the reviews I was ready to box it up and ship it back. At the last minute I decided to give it another try and work the batterys. I bought 2 each of every battery that said digital camera. I also measured the short circuit current of each type of battery. What I found is this camera (and every camera that uses AA's) needs high current NOT high capacity.The flash is essentially a dead short. When the engineers built the bigger zoom (5X) they made the flash bigger. The bigger flash it put a hugh load on the batterys. The best batterys that I found were the Hybrios (new style NiMh that holds it charge for a year another benefit). The Sony high current also worked. When I tested it with fresh charged batterys I gave up after 80 consecutive forced flashs in a row and I got tired of testing. Previously I could get about ten flashes before the batterys failed. This included alkaline as they do not like being shorted. So bottom line is you need about 8 amps short circuit current to make the camera live. Six amps short circuit does not work and the age of the cells counts for a lot. I have tried these cells in a DSLR with the same results they last a long time.

Reviews.Title: Easy -use, 8MP, low price. but not perfect
Reviews.Author: William Metcalfe "Snapperman"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Olympus digital. I wanted something I could slip in a pocket, rather than hang around my neck all day. It's not too small for my sausage fingers, all I need to take fast, easy photos. The 310 is hard on batteries, I keep 2 sets of re-chargeables spare,but would carry more on a big trip. That is my only real criticism.  Since I wrote this review 4 months back I have got a little more skilled and a little less enthusiastic for the FE-310. As other reviewers have said the camera settings revert to the default on switching off which can be exasperating at times. I should have brought a model with view finder too, bright sunlight on the screen makes it difficult to see your subject. Flashlight shots are only any good if one is fairly close in, but the worst feature is battery failure.  Not all re-chargeable NIMH batteries are compatible, be sure to stick with top name brands. Camera still takes nice pics but I reckon now, in hindsight, 3 stars would be more like it.

Reviews.Title: Just Great Overall Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: EuReka
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera but it uses AA batteries instead of the LI-42B like the product description says... so I was upset when I payed $40 for a battery that I couldn't use!!!

Reviews.Title: poor battery life
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Fletcher "Jeff Fletcher"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a problem using NiMH batteries!Because of the lower cell voltage the camera keeps indicating low battery, and stops turning on even with charged NiMH batteries.The instruction manual states the camera will operate on NiMH batteries but from my experience it clearly won't.

Reviews.Title: OLYMPUS FE-310
Reviews.Author: SAM "GEARHEAD 3571"
Reviews.Content: DID NOT LIKE THIS CAMERA. HAD A FEW PROBLEMS WITH IT. MOSTLY IT WOULD KILL BATTERIES VERY FAST(OR IT WOULD SAY BATTERIES EMPTY).IF YOU TOOK THE BATTERIES OUT AND PUT THEM BACK IT WOULD BE ALRIGHT FOR A WHILE BUT THEN IT WOULD START AGAIN. IT TOOK GREAT PIC'S BUT I WAS ALWAYS HAVING PROBLEMS WITH THE BATTERIES. I TRIED A FEW DIFFRENT TYPES BUT NOTHING SEEM TO WORK. I SENT THE CAMERA BACK AND THEY SENT ME A REPLACEMENT AND THAT ONE HAD THE SAME PROBLEMS. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Much Better Than Expected for the Price!!
Reviews.Author: Dennis C. Balduff "bearded moviegoer"
Reviews.Content: Can't give a detailed review at this time but I did want to tell anyone considering this as an entry level e-camera that you can't go wrong.  Excellent results.  I'm a long time old-school SLR user and this is my first adventure into non-film picture taking.  I bought the 2 GB memory card at the same time and installation was easy.  Excellent quality pictures especially on the "motion" setting for action shots.  Buy this and you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: One of the BEST!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer T. Childs
Reviews.Content: I know that this is a great camera.  What don't work for others, works well for some.  The battery life is good.  Instead of me being cheap I keep xtra batteries.  Anything that's battery operated will eventually die out, so buy xtra.  The images are fantastic, the features are second to none, and the price is just right for what you're getting in this camera. There will always be people who will find a problem with somethingand end up disappointed, but you get what you pay for.  GREAT CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Robert Adams "geeky guy in CA"
Reviews.Content: Is this an amazing camera with perfect controls that sips batteries? Nope. But at about $120 it is an amazing camera; Crisp pictures and videos; reasonable buttons/usage; nice sized. I will admit that it does drain batteries FAST, but I've used rechargeable batteries for awhile so it's more an annoyance than any huge drawback.

Reviews.Title: Didn't like this camera either for the same reasons!
Reviews.Author: Joyce Awramik
Reviews.Content: After I returned the Olympus FE340, I thought I'd found a winner with the FE310.  The model out on display had a toggle telephoto on the back, and the sales clerk assured me that it wouldn't change back to default on my settings.  Well, when I got the box home and opened it, to my surprise, the telephoto was that little ball thing in the front again, and again, if you turn off the camera, it will default to AUTO.This one is going back too.  I have now owned 7 Olympus digital cameras.Here's my review of the FE340:  I am a fan of Olympus products, and have owned 5 previous Olympus digital cameras. I was hoping this model would become my new primary photo machine. The price was right, I was attracted by the nifty BLUE color: But dissappointment set in after I took it out of the box. The two features that caused me to return the camera are:#1) the telephoto control is awkward, a pin head sized ball on the front of the camera. I don't know why Olympus decided to get away from the eminently sensible toggle switch on the back which the right thumb could toggle while holding the camera steady with two hands.#2) was the killer though. Whenever the camera was turned off, when you turn it back on it resets itself to the AUTO setting. It didn't hold my setting of FLASH OFF. That resulted in an embarrassing moment in a very solemn situation where expressly there was NO FLASH ALLOWED.At that moment, I knew the camera was going back to the store.I want a camera that holds MY settings, not reverts to the default.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera!
Reviews.Author: Karla Goddard "legalass17"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with such  high hopes only to be crushed.  It takes horrible pictures!  I am accustomed to using a Cannon at work so when I saw this 8MP camera on sale at the local Radio Shack I jumped on it.  It is the perfect size for me to throw into my purse and I had already a bunch of XD memory cards.  Bad choice.  It will not focus for me in the zoom position although I have read the instruction booklet and tried all of the suggestions. About the only way it will take a good picture is if you are outside, good lighting and you are not using the zoom function.  I bought a loser camera.  Do not make the same mistake that I did. The Cannon I use at work focuses in all lighting situations, takes good video and night time pictures.  I should have spent the extra money to get it.  I am sooooo sorry now.  I gave it a decent amount of trying and they won't take the camera back because I have had it over 14 days. I hope this helps someone else out.  I am out my money!

Reviews.Title: What battery life ?
Reviews.Author: Curt Larson
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in May of 2008 to upgrade from an OLD bulky Fuji that was only a 2 Megapixel & a 3x zoom but still took great pictures. It seems right after I bought this model, the poor battery life reviews started to come in, & if I knew this I never would have bought it. Several times I've gotten the no battery warnig on the screen where the camera locks up, & hopefully if I wait a few minutes the batteries gain a little charge so I can take a picture or two before it dies again. Carrying extra batteries was a MUST. ( But should be not necessary )I won't itemize all the concerns, ( soft focus, reset of settings each time it powers up, etc.) as there's a good review on the main page. But as an old 35mm SLR user, I'm used to an optical viewfinder, & just using the screen resulted in too many cut off heads & legs because of the times the screen washed out from bright light & then guessing.I just purchased a Fuji S1000fd & one of the reasons..........besides the screen, OPTICAL VIEWFINDER !

Reviews.Title: Won't Work With Rechargable Batteries
Reviews.Author: Michael Clouser "Donutman"
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this camera!!!  It will NOT work with NiMH batteries (the manual says it will work with NiMH) and it doesn't fully discharge alkaline batteries.  I only got about 50 pictures on the included set of alkaline batteries.I also didn't think that the pictures were all that sharp, for a 8MP camera.  The shutter response is very slow and the face recognition doesn't work until the face fills a large part of the screen.Overall this is a poor camera.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for ...
Reviews.Author: R. Spivey
Reviews.Content: Three stars is generous for this camera and deserved only for its portability and price. I took the FE-310 to my 30-year reunion, and it was the only disappointment of the evening. In low light, it took only mediocre photos. I tried every setting and couldn't get photos I thought were worthy of an 8 megapixel camera. All the portraits had red eye that had to be edited out afterward. Many photos were out of focus. I still kept the camera for a month, taking photos in different settings, indoors and outdoors, and still I felt the photos should have been better for an 8 megapixel camera. I returned it and got my money back. This camera would make a good gift for a child or for someone who just wants easy snapshots without much regard for resolution. As a $100 camera, it suits that purpose just fine.

Reviews.Title: A Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: V. Martinez
Reviews.Content: My son writes this review:  I got this camera for my birthday and it is wonderful. The x5 zoom is extremely good. I took a picture of a ship that was between 1/4 to 1/2 of a mile away and the picture looked like I took it from a few yards away.  I do recommend getting the 2GB chip for the camera. I get about 870 pictures and half an hour of video with the chip.  The only bad thing that bugs me is that the camera gulps down battery juice so I think that carrying at least 2 extra pairs of batteries is good.  In all, this camera is wonderful!!!Using Lithium batterys really works if you don't use the camera all the time. I put some in and I've used them for a week and the battery life icon says it's still full.This is an update about 6 months after I bought this camera:The camera worked fine for about 2 months and then the pictures were really over exposed resulting in almost totally white pictures. We sent the camera in for repairs and got the same one back. I had if for about a month and then realized that the pictures had colored flairs on the screen and the pictures. So we send it back in and they sent the same camera back with the SAME PROBLEM!!! We sent it to Olympus again and they said that they would send me a Sylus 840 free of charge instead of the 310. I'm not sure what happened, if I just got a bad one or if all the cameras are like that.PS: I don't want to say anything terrible against Olympus but the people that work there are (we think) totally illiterate! UGGGGG. The reason I say that is because we specifically asked for a black Stylus but instead they sent me a silver one. Come on Olympus! We know you can do better than that!!!

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE310
Reviews.Author: Luis Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I've had my new camera for about a month now and I like it. Its not the best thing out there but it works. The only thing I don't like is the fact that it goes through batteries like crazy. The images and videos are great. It think its a great camera for beginners.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Allyson Flisser
Reviews.Content: I have owned Canon Cameras for the last 5 years, and switched to try something new and a little cheaper. This product takes great pictures, and wonderfule videos! Now I wont miss out on things in my sons life that could've been caught on tape!

Reviews.Title: Olympus  310
Reviews.Author: Ronnie J. Fairley "R. Fairley"
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for my every day need. As a private investigator, I often have to take discreet pictures and download the photos to an electronic report or email. This camera allows me to set the picture size to 640x480 before I take the picture and this allows my electronic data to be easily transmitted. That is less editing I have to do after I download them on my computer. The 8MP camera allows me to take clear shots in any kind of lighting conditions. The 5x zoom allows me to take clear photos from a distant and this is necessary in my line of work. Last but not least it's pocket size.Olympus FE-310 8MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: Ridiculous camera, ridiculous support
Reviews.Author: Twee
Reviews.Content: Reading buyer comments from a number of sites, it's clear that TERRIBLE battery life is a common issue. Mine worked well only for <100 shots and a handful of videos. Since then, the "battery has no charge" message displays after one shot. I've had the same results whether I'm using rechargeables or alkalines.Other issues include a pause between pushing the button and the actual shot, giving somewhere in the neighborhood of 3 seconds waiting time-- enough for most candid shots to be a miss. And Olympus support basicaly said, "It's a low priced camera, and that's all it does."Awful product, awful support. It's back to canon PowerShots from here on!

Reviews.Title: Great Price / Poor Battery Life
Reviews.Author: Chaitanya Prabhu "MasterYoda"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from amazon (sold by J&R;) because the offer was the best in the category.Good Points:- 5x Optical Zoom (4x Actual Optical + 1x Digital Zoom)- The Guide and Scene mode are designed well to give an regular user the best pictures.The outcome of these pictures are crisp and of good quality- Panaroma Shot (If taken correctly this is a great use for people who want to create their own photo album in new emerging concepts like silverlight etc.)- Video Recording (AVI  files)is nice- Removable Battery (AA)Compare it with models that have  internal chargeable batteries, if they fail then the whole camera is out!!)Bad Points- Battery (Good Point above becomes bad here) The battery life in this model is very bad.I used the 2 AA batteries that came along with this camera and once I was done taking 2-3 pictures Powered Off and left the batteries in the camera.Next day morning when I Powered On it said Battery Empty!!

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Y. Lee "cylp"
Reviews.Content: This is the 7th digial camera in my family.  This is a gift for my youngest son.  My experience with my previous digital cameras taught me 2 things. First, to get rid of problem on recharging battery, I need a camera operating with dry cells.  Second, getting clear picture, optical zoom is much essetential than digital zoom.  The problem of this kind of camera is its thickness.  With 5x Optical Zoom and operating with 2 "AA" batteries, FE-310 can still maintain 1.2" thickness.  It is exactly what I want. Olympus is originally a "camera" manufacturer.  They know the optical well.  FE-310 is easy to use. Picture quality is good.

Reviews.Title: Great Product at a great price!
Reviews.Author: P. Beaubrun
Reviews.Content: Takes nice quality photos. The 5x optical zoom is looks great. If all you're looking for is a simple easy to use quality digital camera, then this is probably one of the best point and shoot cameras on the market.

Reviews.Title: Super Value!
Reviews.Author: Avatar
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use, has lots of great features, and best of all, the picture quality is great! You won't regret buying this one.It does NOT come with the: LI-42B Li-Ion Rechargeable Battery and Charger as the description states. It merely had 2 AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: amazon errors
Reviews.Author: Alan J. Nesbit
Reviews.Content: In your product description you said this camera comes with a lithium-ion battery IT DOES NOT this is the 2nd time I have purchased products with wrong descriptions!!! The last time some things were ambiguously written to sound like certain accessories came with that product they did not!!The camera itself is great.................

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Sondra Macdonald
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is good.  Good buy for the cost.  Compact and light to handle.  Would recommend as a first digital camera.

Reviews.Title: A Good Average Camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in 2008. Still have this camera now that it is going to the ending of 2013. I agree with every reviewer that has said that this camera runs through batteries quickly. It does. I always keep extra on hand. The camera takes AA batteries so pretty easy to find. If you get annoyed with changing batteries a lot, then get the lithium or much more expensive batteries that will last longer. I always keep a spare pair of batteries for the camera on hand on matter what camera I use. I also purchased the 2GB card to go with the camera. Both were delivered quickly and the price was right. It worked fine when I first received it and has pretty much ever since.I am not a hugely picky person and do not know why people would really want a camera like this if you are looking for a camera that works like a professional camera does. Would recommend for beginners and people who are not using the camera to do all sorts of tricks that professionals use a high end camera for. If you are just looking to get that kind of quality cheaply, that just does not happen. Try investing in a professional camera then. You get what you pay for. I just purchased this as someone who wants to take pictures on vacations and different events as a point and shoot type of camera. I am reading complaints about wanting a viewfinder at the same time batteries draining, but if you are taking pictures in a brightly lit area then why are you even bothering to use a flash? Taking the flash setting off saves a little on the battery life. Sounds more like someone who wants to get professional quality photos using a cheap camera.As for the camera resetting to default when turned off. It does. I am absolutely fine with that. I usually only use the basic settings and do not need to keep fiddling with the camera trying to get that perfect setting for that perfect shot. If I wanted that all the time, that would be why I would purchase a professional camera for. The cameras that you are dropping a lot more than what you are for this discount camera. I actually take the batteries out and store them elsewhere for later use when I am not using the camera, since it will automatically default to automatic when I turn it back on.Overall the camera works fine and has been since I received it and that is all I was looking for. Again, if you are looking for a camera that gives high end camera results then you should be looking elsewhere to invest in a professional camera. This gives you your average good quality pictures for the point and shoot type of photos.

Reviews.Title: Awesome and well worth the price !!
Reviews.Author: Mitchel W. Racanelli
Reviews.Content: I only paid $19.95 for this Camera , (refurbished), and bought a 2 gigabyte Olympus SD card for another $19.95 , so for around  $ 40.00 +/- I got an awesome camera with over 5800 possible pictures & the camera comes with the software used to download photos, and the camera has zoom ,  and other features too numerous to mention !! All in all this camera is very well worth the price ,  and yes you can mount it on a tripod ,  and use it as a video camera with sound , to connect directly to your computer , and yes the cables are also provided !! An exceptional camera !! This is one very satisfied customer !!

Reviews.Title: Great pics but ...
Reviews.Author: Maria Siebertz
Reviews.Content: the camera takes great pics but the batteries are out of power much too fast. I have since sold camera at a resale shop.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Toscano
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter as the price was right and an upgrade from what she was using. The item was packaged in a factory refurb box and came with all the paper work and even 2 sets of batteries. I was a little bit disappointed with the plastics as the front of the camera had some scratches and scuffs. While I have occasionally seen this on refurbs, usually the plastics are like new or replaced. With that aside everything works great on the camera until I realized it need a memory card. This camera takes a special Olympus style card so I ordered one up only to find that the spring loading mechanism for the memory card in the camera did not work. So I wedged a little piece of paper in there to keep it in place and locked up the little door. It has been performing great ever since. I did not contact the seller concerning these issues so I cannot review that experience. Olympus FE-310 8MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Silver)

Reviews.Title: Olympus fe-310 Camera
Reviews.Author: Gerard Kling "Books a million"
Reviews.Content: This camera is just what they said it was. I left my original Olympus fe-310 Camera on the counter at Comp USA in Deerfield Beach Florida. I already had all the cards, wires, cables and other accessories so ordering a used camera was just what the doctor ordered.Everything functions fine. I use this camera in my job as a property manager everyday.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Photos, Terrifically Handy
Reviews.Author: V. M. Staib "Living an Enjoyable Life"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace same camera of older vintage which was run over by a car (that's another long story for another time).  I sought out and bought this one because I was so pleased with the performance and size of the original.  One of the features I had purchased the first one for was a setting specifically for taking photos of items for eBay. That is one of the many "standard" settings on this camera and it really is worth having. I like the size as it is small enough to carry in my purse so that I can catch photos of particularly outstanding flowers when I come across them.  I have seen my photos up against professional close-ups of flowers and have seen no difference.  So why should I spend $600 or more!  That the camera uses AA batteries and never has to be on a charger is terrific.  I just carry along a couple of extra batteries just in case and if I don't have them I can duck into any convenience store and buy some.  Battery life is, however, excellent so I rarely have to pop in new ones in any hurry. There are drawbacks of course too.  My only complaint is that the camera is so small that it is sometimes hard to get a clear picture when you are snapping photos at an event.  There is an anti-shake setting but I usually forget.  For photographing website or eBay items I use a tripod.  I have only used the camera to computer USB hookup once and it was not difficult.  In short (LOL) this is worth its price and if I run over this one I will be back to buy another.

Reviews.Title: finicky and unreliable
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for about three years, and I've figured out ways around some of its most irritating quirks. Still, I regret buying it.- Battery life can be solved by using lithium batteries and turning down the screen brightness when you have a longer time between shots. It's not really that big of an issue if you do these two things.- The white balance is terrible! You can't adjust it all. Cameras at half this price have several different WB settings. This is just auto WB. Pathetic.- Any time you are using zoom, the auto-focus becomes hit-or-miss. I have lost many good shots because the camera just won't focus. Macro shots usually won't focus, either.- Almost no manual control. You can adjust the exposure comp and the ISO. That's it. And the ISO only goes up to 640.- Image stabilisation is bogus. It just changes the shutter speed, which changes everything in your shot. Worse than worthless.I will say that the video is decent, though far from HD resolution. Even in this case, though, you must turn the sound recording off if you want to use auto-focus.Honestly, this is one of the worst purchases I have ever made. I would trade it in a heartbeat for a camera half its price, because they almost all have white balance settings, good auto-focus, and ISO up to 1600.

Reviews.Title: Regrets....had I know
Reviews.Author: mills0001
Reviews.Content: The lack of battery life is a huge problem.  Countless lost photos is heartbreaking.  Had I know, I would have never purchased this camera.  In the process of researching a different digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Black blob has appeared on viewer screen of this NEW camera!
Reviews.Author: Diana Rabenold
Reviews.Content: Only weeks after receiving this camera, a black blob about 1/2 inch long and 1/4 inch wide has appeared on the inside of the viewing screen (meaning, it's not on the outside surface).  It does appear on the print-outs, but it definitely interferes with the viewing, and I am fearful it may GROW LARGER!  I did not drop the camera, or anything else untoward, to cause this:  it just appeared one day.  Would really like to have this camera replaced!

Reviews.Title: Broke down after 4 days
Reviews.Author: Pseudonym
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of the comments on battery life.  More troublesome, however, is that the camera completely died after just 4 days, 10 pictures, and 3 battery changes...  It will not respond or turn on, and the lens is stuck in the open position.  The camera is a complete lemon.

Reviews.Title: A Solid Digital Camera.
Reviews.Author: Brian MOORE "filmbuster"
Reviews.Content: This FE-310 Model Camera, built by Olympus, a company in the photographic equipment industry that has always held up to a high degree of quality and durability, is easier to use than the 2 previous digital cameras that I've owned, and for the price(* especially at used prices) to get this 5X ZOOM LENSE power at that low price is a very good bargain. On the subject of this camera's BATTERY USAGE, that at least one previous reviewer  has raised, it's better than the 2 other digital cameras that I had before in that it does NOT quickly "EAT" them up, and please also keep in mind that this camera uses the "everyday," and cheaper, easier-to-find "AA" Alkaline etcetera batteries, unlike the far more EXPENS$IVE CR-2 and CR123 Camera/Photo Battteries that I've had to use on two other cameras. So, given my experience with previous digital cameras(one a Kodak 5.0 megapixel, the other a Vivitar model camera)which both DID actually "EAT" up their batteries, this one has had GOOD to Very good battery life, from my experiences(* only shot 2 xD cards through it, NOT a "huge amount of experience" with the camera, I will admit), so for the more circumspect, I would say that this Olympus camera offers very much, SATISFACTORY battery life, in comparison to other/earlier digital cameras. I WOULD always bring along at least 1-2 extra pairs of back-up "AA" batteries, however, on just about any shoot where you need to travel even a short distance from "modern," ah-hem, "Civilization". As for photo-picture quality, this Olympus has really delivered for me, with very high quality digital photos, be they online or printed-out through my Canon Photo Printer, and going by friends' digital photos that's not just due to my present Olympus FE-310 having the higher(8.0 Megapixels) megapixel performance rating.

Reviews.Title: Poor battery life
Reviews.Author: B. Crammond
Reviews.Content: Don't touch it with a 10 foot barge pole, battery life is nil.  From various issues I have seen on the web it is a design issue.  Basically the only batteries I can get to work are the expensive lithium ones and then if you leave then it the discharge over a couple of months of non use.Was going to let my girls play with it but I spend to much on batteries.

Reviews.Title: Warmnfriendly
Reviews.Author: Alan Corbin
Reviews.Content: This truely is a great camera overall.We all need a digital camera which is "user friendly", and this is the camera!Unlike the "one" negative comment, this review is right-on!P.S., Just as with all digital cameras/realted devices...you must use Lithium Batteries for optimum performance. This is clearly recommended in the owner's manual so let's be fair when blogging. :-)

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE310 TMS
Reviews.Author: T. Skaggs "RedThom"
Reviews.Content: The camera had all the features I was looking for and was quite easy to use.  However, when I attempted to download photos from it, I found that it was not possible because the camera caused a power surge in the USB port.  The vendor I purchased the camera from was willing to replace it but they tried several others of the same model before shipping one of them to me and had the same exact result with each one.  I would NOT recommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: brie livingston
Reviews.Content: firstly, use only lithium batteries or you will be replacing them every five minutes. good thing about AA lithium batteries is that they can be found just about anywhere, whereas olympus wants you to use some unusual battery pack that would be hard to find. also, if i am in the middle of something, i don't want to wait hours for batteries to recharge! better to just take a minute to pop in some new AA lithiums! with standard memory it takes 60 excellent photos on the 1 meg setting. nice video with sound on 60 second setting.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Angry Customer
Reviews.Content: Batteries left in this camera simply do not retain a charge, even over night. Even when batteries were fresh, camera was good for 3 or 4 pictures before they were exhausted. Camera had to be returned to Olympus TWICE for repair. Focus was poor, colors were lousy. I WILL NEVER BUY OLYMPUS AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Wilma "Wilma"
Reviews.Content: Bought this little inexpensive thing to tote around until I decide what camera I really want. Easy to use. Took a few nice still shots and close ups with it.Others have already said it: it devours batteries!!! It happened a few times now, that I couldn't take a precious snap shot because the battery was empty :-( Forget rechargeable batteries, they are not strong enough. And who wants to keep spending money on Duracell & Co? With the money I invested into batteries I could have bought a better camera already.Another negative is that it is slow. Sometimes you have to wait a few seconds before you can take the next pic because the camera is still busy registering the last picture.Colors are strange too at times. The reds come out very strong.So, overall it's not worth buying.

Reviews.Title: UGH!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Atkinson
Reviews.Content: I despise this camera! It drives me crazy! Within the first 10-20 minutes of trying to figure out how to use it, I went threw 4 batteries! And THEN, the screen funked out! Every time I tried to take a picture, the screen just went black, even though I had no other pictures, and a full battery! Dont waist your money OR time!

Reviews.Title: Battery HOG!!
Reviews.Author: E. Stanley "E Stanley"
Reviews.Content: This camera is my fourth digital camera.I used the batteries that the camera came with and was able to update my camera via the website.The batteries were no drained after that.I have been disappointed with the poor quality of my photos and hope to work out a solution.I got this as a gift and I hope that my husband didn't pay too much for this.I have had a FUJI, Canon and Panasonic.I wouldn't pay more than 100 dollars for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the money
Reviews.Author: Dave Lansing
Reviews.Content: Sounds like some people have models that drain batteries severely, but most digital cameras are rough on Alkaline AA's.  I got it cheap and took it to the bar last night and was happy.  I went through about 75 shots and had to change batteries, that is good enough for me.  It holds around 450 pictures with a 1G XD card.  It has features that cannot be beat with all the shooting modes.  So far the only setting that loses its' preference when the power is off is the flash mode (auto flash, red-eye, constant, or off).  For the money, this is a good entry lever camera.

Reviews.Title: Gave it as a gift and they seem to like it.
Reviews.Author: Mac Man
Reviews.Content: Don't really have much to say about it since I am not using it but the price was good and the features were right. I can tell you to not put cheap batterys in it but other than that it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Battery life is no good
Reviews.Author: M. A. Stuart
Reviews.Content: I've had one of these for 4 months now and I want to echo the negative comments here about the battery life as it sucks. It's amazing how little it lasts. Everything else is OK... I get plenty of blurry one's, but that may be me as I've had that issue with all my digital cams. Also, there is no small view finder, only the big one, but that's not really an issue for me as I'm just amateur with photos and only use that one anyway.Just how bad is the battery life? With my brand new rechargeables, we're talking about 5 - 10 photos! With normal alkalines, it varies... I've gotten nearly 100 but also a lot less. I didn't actually try nickle cads because it came with alkakines and I happen to (fortunately)currently have a big pile of them. I reckon that pile will quickly diminish the more I use my camera.Otherwise, however, a pretty good camera, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Camera
Reviews.Author: Sylvia
Reviews.Content: Please see past the perks and notice the simple problem that will waste your money!The camera has issues with batteries, by issues i mean it will not work on your standard set of batteries (alkaline) because of the large screen and other reasons.  I only receive a couple of shots from the batteries, then they die.  Also you will be unable to use a view finder because there ISNT one.  This means there is no option to save the batteries using a view finder.DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA.

Reviews.Title: Run don't Walk away from this camera
Reviews.Author: R. S. Little
Reviews.Content: Run fast, Run far.  This camera doesn't want to operate on any batteries.  On FE-310 # 2 so far in two months and the same problem.  Tech support advises not to use alkaline batteries(which in fact come with the camera).  Told to use NiMH batteries - NADA.  Spent about $50 on batteries and chargers.  They also gave me "Olympus" rechargeable batteries - still NADA.  Sending camera # 2 back to them -  hopefully to get a refund.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Cuicui Lu
Reviews.Content: I do not say the product is not good. Just I do not like it because it is too thick in shape and I do not like to change batteries too much.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Lu
Reviews.Content: I purchased the FE-310 and think it is a good buy for the money.  I am still learning how to use all the controls.

Reviews.Title: olympus
Reviews.Author: Saul Melendrez
Reviews.Content: beautiful camera one of the best i have nice pictures very very cleargood zoom reduce red eye

Reviews.Title: I am soooooo happy!
Reviews.Author: Ronald Dokes "Shutter Bug"
Reviews.Content: Olympus FE-310 8MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Black)I could not be happier with this purchase.Great pictures, no film processing, no hassles.The merchant delivered ahead of estimated timeand gets two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: Battery Life
Reviews.Author: P. Bucy "Pete"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera three weeks ago. Battery life when using Energizer e2 2500mhr rechargeable batteries has been very good. I have taken over 300 photographs (outdoor, no flash) on a single pair of batteries.I ride a motorcycle recreationally. Every bit of storage space is precious. This camera fits nicely in the pocket of my leather jacket and is there whenever I want it. The controls and settings are very intuitive and it takes a pretty good picture too.

Reviews.Title: OH YEAH!
Reviews.Author: James R. Simpson "NC_Ron"
Reviews.Content: The Olympus FE-310 works as advertised. It is easy to use and takes great digital pictures. OH Yeah, I would not hesitate to buy this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Great 1st Camera
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: this camera was my first digital camera and it has been great. It has great focusing and takes large pics. Each pic is 3264x2448 pixels

Reviews.Title: Not a bad little camera
Reviews.Author: Miga75
Reviews.Content: After searching and searching, and searching for a digital camera online, I decided on this one b/c it was a high MP and a fairly low price. It did take nice pictures, but I was bummed about having to get the special Olympus cards which are quite a bit more than what you can get a regular SD card for most anywhere. I'm still learning how to best use all the different settings it has. The fireworks setting worked great this 4th of July except when my hand was a little shaky!  :)Small enough to slide into a pocket or purse without noticing a lot of weight added. Overall, not a bad little camera.

Reviews.Title: Good first digital camera
Reviews.Author: Wine Guy
Reviews.Content: Like any camera in this price range there will be some drawbacks, but for for a digital novice its ease of use and overall performance are tops. Battery life with disposable lithiums is more than adequate for normal travel use or a day at the beach or theme park. Extended zoom a big plus. Great budget camera.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Camera FE 310
Reviews.Author: Big Poppi
Reviews.Content: Great camera and the kicker is that it has an audio-video featutre...great. I have an older model and they are both wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Olympus FE-310 Review
Reviews.Author: Pug Lover
Reviews.Content: I have found this little camera to be very easy to use, and lots of fun.  Controls are conveniently placed, making for ease of operation.  I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Daughter Loved It
Reviews.Author: Suzanne Brean
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter's graduation.  She has been enjoying it immensely.  I do recommend purchasing a 2 gig memory card when you purchase the camera.

Reviews.Title: Olympus camera
Reviews.Author: Winston
Reviews.Content: It has been great fun so far using the camera. ideal for beginners, and great picture taking.

Reviews.Title: awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Krishna Sowjanya Tatta
Reviews.Content: great camera. I bought it as a birthday present and its awesome. i love the clarity of the pictures and the ease of using this cam. great!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Too many problems.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over a year now.  First - wow - what's with the huge price increase?  I paid $110 in May of 08 and I couldn't recommend it at that price.  It takes beautiful pictures - when it works correctly.One of the reasons we chose this model was because it used AA batteries available anywhere.  6 months into owning the camera it started draining normal AA batteries after about 6 pictures, sometimes less.  We sent it to the service center who kept it for a month, sent it back the week before Christmas claiming it was fixed and as soon as we popped in new batteries it died again.  Thank goodness we still had our old Sony for use at Christmas that year.  We sent this camera back again and this time they told us it was our fault - we needed to use a more powerful battery.  We didn't before, but o.k., I bought the most powerful rechargable AA's I could find and we can usually get a whole day out of them now before they need recharged.In the last month however it has now started taking only half the picture or worse - not at all.  When we download the pictures half the frame or sometimes the entire frame - will be greyed out.We are in the market for another new digital and will no doubt go back to Sony.  I don't trust Olympus anymore.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: M. Hernando
Reviews.Content: I love this brand, is the best for me. I had another Olympus Camera but I wanted to change to update, it takes great and quality photos. I am so glad for have gotten this product.

Reviews.Title: care share
Reviews.Author: Washburn Lewis
Reviews.Content: my camera olympus FE-310 8mp digital is one of my better buy 'i have no regret in buying it  thank you amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Rufus
Reviews.Content: I have used Olympus products for a long time. Very dependable and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Graham "photography nut"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the fact that it's a Olympus, and my other camera is as well.  I'm amazed how great the pictures come out.  It has lots of options and is user friendly. I agree with others comments about the batteries not lasting long but I just carry extra charged batteries and it only takes a few seconds to change them.  I would recommend this camera to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Brand new & would not focus.
Reviews.Author: A. Thompson
Reviews.Content: We got this camera right before we moved overseas.  We threw away the box and could not find the receipt in the confusion of moving. We never got to print or upload any photos because the camera would not focus. Now we are stuck and have to send it off and PAY for it to be fixed.  Plus, we have to deal with all the hassle in doing so since we don't live in the US. Who knows how long that will take.  So, I went ahead and got my daughter a new camera - NIKON. We also have a CANON and love it. Wont buy an Olympus again!!!

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy it
Reviews.Content: I'm 13 and so yea...I bought this camera at target because i wanted to upgrade from my out of date hp camera. It was on sale, so I thought it was a good buy.But the camera it self is terrible.The battery life is very poor, so you would have to get rechargables and the shutter button doesnt work properly. You have to hold it down for like, a minute until it actually takes the picture.Picture quality would probably be like, a C-. It's lame, i have to edit all of my pictures for them to look goodWhen you delete a picture, that's a whole other problem. I am thinking of a buying a waterproof camera, and i noticed that olympus has them also, Yea, right like i'd waste my money on another lame camera by Olympus.If your looking for a good camera, I'd recommend canon or nikon. The image quality on those are really good.

Reviews.Title: The Worst Seller in the Word
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel M. Gugwor "Latifun"
Reviews.Content: This seller, ReRunDeals, deals with derelict and ruined items. The company's customer services are the worst I had experienced in Amazon marketplace and in any other place imaginable in the whole worldwide. The company sells kaput, worn out and unsatisfactory products to his customers and calls the products "Grade A" refurbished. This company will give you a hard time, and does not know anything about customer satisfaction. My experience with this company was very ghastly awful. Buyers beware of this company-ReRunDeals! My recommendation: do not choose any product from this company, as you will not get your money's worth.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.0-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
5x image-stabilized optical zoom; Face Detection
Perfect Shot Preview mode
Includes Olympus Master 2 software
Stores images on xD Picture Cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus FE-310 8MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom (Silver)
